---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: If this is really a split, should be `chore` rather than `feat`?

### PR summary

#### Import changes

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.RingTheory.OreLocalization.Basic | 564 | 363 | -201 (-35.64%) |
| Mathlib.GroupTheory.MonoidLocalization | 542 | 545 | +3 (+0.55%) |

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ AddOreSet`
`+ instance : Add X[S‚Åª¬π]`
`+ instance : AddCommGroup X[S‚Åª¬π]`
`+ instance : AddMonoid X[S‚Åª¬π]`
`+ instance : DistribMulAction R X[S‚Åª¬π]`
`+ instance : DistribMulAction R[S‚Åª¬π] X[S‚Åª¬π]`
`+ instance : DivisionRing R[R‚Å∞‚Åª¬π]`
`+ instance : Module R[S‚Åª¬π] X[S‚Åª¬π]`
`+ instance : Monoid R[S‚Åª¬π]`
`+ instance : Mul R[S‚Åª¬π]`
`+ instance : MulAction R X[S‚Åª¬π]`
`+ instance : One R[S‚Åª¬π]`
`+ instance : Ring R[S‚Åª¬π]`
`+ instance : SMul R X[S‚Åª¬π]`
`+ instance : SMul R[S‚Åª¬π] X[S‚Åª¬π]`
`+ instance : Semiring R[S‚Åª¬π]`
`- divisionRing`
`- instAddCommGroupOreLocalization`
`- instAddMonoidOreLocalization`
`- instAddOreLocalization`
`- instDistribMulActionOreLocalization`
`- instDistribMulActionOreLocalization'`
`- instModuleOreLocalization`
`- instMonoidOreLocalization`
`- instMulActionOreLocalization'`
`- instMulOreLocalization`
`- instOneOreLocalization`
`- instSMulOreLocalization`
`- instSMulOreLocalization'`
`- instSemiringOreLocalization`
`- ring`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>
In general, it LGTM: thanks! I am going to test the `to_additive` attribute a bit, and then I will send it to maintainers.

There is something strange with the @additive going on, I believe: I tried the following code on line 122 of `Basic`
```lean
open AddOreLocalization

example {A : Type u_1} [AddMonoid A] {B : AddSubmonoid A} [AddOreSet B]
  {Y : Type} [AddAction A Y] {r‚ÇÅ r‚ÇÇ : Y} {s‚ÇÅ s‚ÇÇ : B} :
  r‚ÇÅ -‚Çí s‚ÇÅ = r‚ÇÇ -‚Çí s‚ÇÇ ‚Üî ‚àÉ u v, u +·µ• r‚ÇÇ = v +·µ• r‚ÇÅ ‚àß u + s‚ÇÇ = v + s‚ÇÅ := by
  have := @oreSub_eq_iff A _ B _ Y _ r‚ÇÅ r‚ÇÇ s‚ÇÅ s‚ÇÇ
  constructor
  ¬∑ intro h
    replace this := this.mp h
    exact this
```
and there are problems. In my opinion they come from a coercion from a subtype to `Type` that behaves oddly in the additive case. Do you see what goes on?

This is because only `u` is an element of `B`.
```
example {A : Type*} [AddMonoid A] {B : AddSubmonoid A} [AddOreLocalization.AddOreSet B]
  {Y : Type} [AddAction A Y] {r‚ÇÅ r‚ÇÇ : Y} {s‚ÇÅ s‚ÇÇ : B} :
    r‚ÇÅ -‚Çí s‚ÇÅ = r‚ÇÇ -‚Çí s‚ÇÇ ‚Üî ‚àÉ (u : B) (v : A), u +·µ• r‚ÇÇ = v +·µ• r‚ÇÅ ‚àß u + s‚ÇÇ = v + s‚ÇÅ :=
  AddOreLocalization.oreSub_eq_iff
```

I removed the names of instances and incorporated the other suggestions. 
Thanks a lot for the thorough review!

Thanks!

maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by faenuccio.

Thanks!

bors merge

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9454619873/job/26042576322)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9454709469/job/26042888509)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9454709469/job/26042888078)

OK, I tried another (final...) round of renaming suggestions for the additive version. The rationale has been, as you suggested, that if the name is too long we let it go. But I wonder if this is optimal.

```suggestion
@[to_additive AddOreLocalization.oreEqv "The setoid on `R √ó S` used for the Ore localization."]
```

```suggestion
@[to_additive "The difference `s -‚Çí 0` as a an additive unit."]
```

```suggestion
fulfilling the Ore condition."]
```

```suggestion
@[to_additive "The subtraction in the Ore localization,
```
Is "factor" appropriate in the additive setting?
Maybe not, but I don't have a better term for it. Do you have any suggestions?
"which differ by a common summand"? or "which are translated by a common summand"?

```suggestion
  additive-units of `T`, to a morphism `AddOreLocalization R S ‚Üí+ T`."]
```
But are you replacing it somewhere else in this PR?
No but this will become rfl in the next PR.
But then I'd keep it here now and remove it in the next PR, no? Or am I missing something? Are you suggesting that we temporarily "deprive" mathlib of this lemma?
I would hope that I won't have to touch this file again so I moved these into `GroupTheory/MonoidLocalization.lean` for now.

```suggestion
/-- The Ore localization of a monoid and a submonoid fulfilling the ore condition. -/
```
A second Ore (in "ore" condition) that needs to be capitalized.

```suggestion
/-- The division in the Ore localization `X[S‚Åª¬π]`, as a fraction of an element of `X` and `S`. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- The scalar multiplication on the Ore localization of monoids. -/
@[to_additive "the vector addition on the Ore localization of additive monoids."]
```

```suggestion
arbitrary translation `t` if `t + s ‚àà S`."]
```

```suggestion
@[to_additive "A difference is equal to its expansion by a summand from `S`."]
```

```suggestion
@[to_additive "Differences whose minuends differ by a common summand can be proven equal if
those summands expand to equal elements of `R`."]
```

```suggestion
/-- A submonoid `S` of an additive monoid `R` is (left) Ore if common summands on the right can be
```

```suggestion
turned into common summands on the left, and if each pair of `r : R` and `s : S` admits an Ore
```

```suggestion
  /-- Common summands on the right can be turned into common summands on the left, a weak form of
```
Following the changes in `Basic` I'd change this "common factors" (and related things) to the translations.
Sure. I just pushed [a commit](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13559/commits/932f692aa7ff4d12fc2020b0daef5a6039ab63fb) fixing them. Please double check that the wording is good.

```suggestion
  "The Ore condition of a difference, expressed in terms of `oreMin` and `oreSubtra`."]
```
You could perhaps add here a sentence saying that alghough here everything is multiplicative, there exists an additive version in `bla/bla/file.lean`.

```suggestion
/-- The Ore localization of a monoid and a submonoid fulfilling the Ore condition. -/
```

```suggestion
@[to_additive AddOreLocalization "The Ore localization of an additive monoid and a submonoid
```
Is this notation really defined? I have tried to use it with `open AddOreLocalization` and `open scoped AddOreLocalization`  but it did not work.
Thanks! fixed.

Right now, the way to declare that something is and additive Ore set is by `open`ing  `AddOreLocalization` and then declaring `OreSet`; in analogy with `AddMonoid` and `AddSubmonoid`, wouldn't it be more coherent to have a (possibly localized, in the sense of the namespace `AddOreLocalization`) declaration `AddOreSet`?
The current `OreSet` is under the namespace `OreLocalization`. Do you mean `AddOreLocalization.AddOreSet`?

It seems to me that right now there are two declarations `oreSet`, one in `OreLocalization` and one in `AddOreLocalization`. I am suggesting to rename the second to become `AddOreSet`. As to whether we should keep the namespace `AddOreLocalization`, I'm happy with whatever you suggest. Or did I misunderstand your question?
Renamed to `AddOreLocalization.AddOreSet`.

This instance' name becomes `instZeroOreLocalization` rather than `instZeroAddOreLocalization`: can the second be forced? This happens many time (the previous, for instance, becomes `oreSubAddChar'`): how should we tackle this/do we have other examples in the library?
Goot catch. Fixed. I think this example is particularly confusing for `to_additive` because `OreLocalization` is mixed into a longer camel-case name. This shouldn't happen that often.

Well, unfortunately it happens all over the file (see `oreDiv` or `oreDivSmulChar`, etc...). I do not think it is reasonable to fix all them by hand, or at least it will certainly be painful. That's why I was asking for a reference in the library to see how this kind of things are handled. I am happy to ask on Zulip if you prefer. And I am sorry for making this review so long, it should have been an "easy chore splitting..." ;-)
I think the generated `AddOreLocalization.oreSubAddChar'` is the correct name?
Why not `AddOreLocalization.addOreSubAddChar'`?
If the instance got changed from `OreLocalization` to `AddOreLocalization` this should be consistent. Or perhaps not. Or we could remove all these `ore` and possibly make something `private`?
I think calling `a -‚Çí b` `oreSub` is already distinctive enough. `addOreSub` is a bit too long for a basic operation IMO.

```suggestion
@[to_additive AddOreLocalization "The Ore localization of an additive monoid and a submonoid
fulfilling the Ore condition."]
def OreLocalization {R : Type*} [Monoid R] (S : Submonoid R) [OreSet S]
```
This is a type and should be capitalized.
Oh right, sorry. Changed.

```suggestion
@[to_additive  AddOreLocalization.instAddActionAddOreLocalization]
```

I think the solution to these is maybe to not name the instance and the to-additive version and let lean handle the names, as the generated names seem good enough and we will almost never refer to this.
Yes, in the end I agree. Please commit whatever you prefer and leave the rest. I will then be happy to call the maintainers for the merge, just ping me.

```suggestion
@[to_additive AddOreLocalization.instAddMonoidAddOreLocalization]
```

```suggestion
@[to_additive AddOreLocalization.instVAddAddOreLocalization]
```
And why the prime?

```suggestion
@[to_additive instAddActionAddOreLocalization']
```
Why isn't it called something like `.oreSubtra`?
Oops fixed.

```suggestion
@[to_additive AddOreLocalization.add_ore_eq
```

```suggestion
@[to_additive AddOreLocalization.addOreSetBot]
```

```suggestion
@[to_additive AddOreLocalization.addOreCondition
```

```suggestion
@[to_additive AddOreLocalization.addOreSetComm]
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(RingTheory/OreLocalization/Basic): Split file and to-additivise
